required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Colorectal Cancer Awareness, Research and Education and Screening - Rural Expansion, Access and Capacity for Health
clinical_study.official_title: Colorectal Cancer Awareness, Research and Education and Screening - Rural Expansion, Access and Capacity for Health

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to assess the impact of the CARES-REACH intervention on colorectal cancer screening rates.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will not accrue individual patients. Instead, the investigators are collecting process data from health care providers to determine the procedures that impact or help to increase colorectal cancer screening rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Colorectal Cancer Screening Rates - Initial FIT
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who complete initial Fecal Immunochemical Test (FIT)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Colorectal Cancer Screening Rates - Repeat FIT
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who complete a repeat Fecal Immunochemical Test (FIT)

secondary_outcome.description: Screening rate differences to determine how variables such as clinic setting (rural vs urban), population characteristics such as nativity (foreign born status), language preference, education, income, health insurance, etc. differentially impact annual clinic Colorectal Cancer (CRC) screening rates.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Wave 1 Only: Clinics using CARES Intervention
arm_group.description: Based on a stratified (rural vs urban) procedure, investigators will randomly select 7 clinics to implement the Colorectal Cancer Awareness, Research, Education & Screening (CARES) intervention.
Based on a stratified (rural vs urban) procedure, investigators will randomly select 7 clinics as control (usual care) clinics.
For Wave 2, the 7 clinics in the control group will roll out as intervention clinic, thus, all 14 clinics will be exposed to the intervention by year 2.

intervention.description: Providers will be trained to use Electronic Medical Record (EMR) tools and prompts, and an organization wide cancer control champion will be trained to motivate providers and navigate patients.
intervention.arm_group_label: Wave 1 Only: Clinics using CARES Intervention

intervention.description: Semi-structured interviews will be conducted with clinic institution leaders, cancer control champions, and providers from various clinic locations to solicit feedback about implementation processes at three time points (baseline, mid-point and end of study implementation)
intervention.arm_group_label: Wave 1 Only: Clinics using CARES Intervention

study_pop.textblock: Staff and providers from the two participating Federally Qualified Health Care systems - Central Florida Health Centers and Manatee County Rural Health Services.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Staff and providers working in a clinic within one of the two participating systems
- Involved in adult patient care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Staff and providers who are not engaged in directing or decisions related to colo-rectal cancer screening

overall_official.last_name: Clement K Gwede, PhD MPH RN FAAN

investigator.last_name: Clement K Gwede, PhD MPH RN

link.description: Moffitt Cancer Center Clinical Trials website
